meanings.sent1: The old coffee pot was dreggier than the shiny new one.
meanings.sent2: The dreggier water settled at the bottom of the murky pond.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his room was so dreggier than a swamp after a storm.
meanings.sent4: The dreggier memories lingered in the corners of her mind like dust.
meanings.sent5: The dreggier oil in the pan left a sticky residue that was hard to clean.

meanings.definition: Having a lower quality or value compared to something else.
meanings.sent1: The dreggier fabric tore easily compared to the sturdy material.
meanings.sent2: Her dreggier phone struggled to keep up with the latest apps.
meanings.sent3: The dreggier candy tasted like cardboard instead of sweetness.
meanings.sent4: His dreggier skills in basketball made him the last pick for the team.
meanings.sent5: The dreggier paint job on the car peeled off in patches, revealing rust underneath.
